messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Spell check help needed
messages.msgSnippet: ... For spellcheck, download the Google toolbar.  I LOVE my Google toolbar.  It has a Google search part, a popup blocker and spellcheck. I also like that when
messages.messageBody:
On 6/27/06, Joanne <oh.kneel@...> wrote:
>

> I am a quick typer easily vulnerable for typo errors. How can I
> access spell check for posting? When I try to delete sections of
> people's message to keep the part I am responding to, I see there is a
> whole box in which they wrote with small squares at each corner. It
> makes it a bit more difficult to respond (as I frequently accidently
> end up deleteing the whole box) but I am learning :) So how can I do
> that and have access to spell check? Thanks, Joanne (Lake Carmel, NY)
>

For spellcheck, download the Google toolbar. I LOVE my Google
toolbar. It has a Google search part, a popup blocker and spellcheck.
I also like that when I google something and go to a webpage that was
in my search I can highlight the words that I was googling so I can
find it easier.

Recently Yahoogroups made a change in the way that messages are sent
out. I had the same problem and found that I needed to go to
yahoogroups, sign in, and go to each individual group I am in and
click "edit membership" Scroll to the bottom and check "traditional"
and save changes. This will stop the messages from coming in "rich
formatting." Very annoying! I have the option on my gmail of
changing messages to rich or plain text formatting when I reply to
them. Your email package may have a similar function that you can use
until messages start coming in plain text.


--
Michelle
aka Melbrigða
http://eventualknitting.blogspot.com
MedHS@yahoogroups.com - Homeschooling for the Medieval Recreationist

messages.subject: Spell check help needed
messages.msgSnippet: I am a quick typer easily vulnerable for typo errors.  How can I access spell check for posting?  When I try to delete sections of people s message to keep the
messages.messageBody:
I am a quick typer easily vulnerable for typo errors. How can I
access spell check for posting? When I try to delete sections of
people's message to keep the part I am responding to, I see there is a
whole box in which they wrote with small squares at each corner. It
makes it a bit more difficult to respond (as I frequently accidently
end up deleteing the whole box) but I am learning :) So how can I do
that and have access to spell check? Thanks, Joanne (Lake Carmel, NY)
